content:
I think what I like most about living in Tokyo is the convenience and the fact that there's always something to do. I mean, whether it's trying new restaurants, visiting museums, or just exploring new neighborhoods, there's always something new to discover. And yeah, the food is amazing too!

As for challenges, I'd say one of the biggest ones has been the language barrier. I've been taking Japanese lessons, but it's still not easy communicating with people who don't speak English. Also, the commute to work can be pretty long, but I've been using that time to listen to audiobooks and podcasts, so it's not so bad.

What about you, do you have any recommendations for good podcasts or audiobooks? I'm always looking for new ones to listen to!
